meanings.definition: The act of taking possession of property or assets.
meanings.sent1: After the court ruling, he finally gained full seizins of the house.
meanings.sent2: She had to prove her seizins of the land before selling it.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a skit about a mix-up in seizins of a valuable painting.
meanings.sent4: His love for music was like seizins of his soul, holding it close and never letting go.
meanings.sent5: The image of the pirate seizing seizins of the treasure chest was etched in his mind.

meanings.definition: The legal right to possess property or assets.
meanings.sent1: The deed confirmed her seizins over the entire estate.
meanings.sent2: His seizins of the company were challenged in the court case.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully argued over their seizins of the family car.
meanings.sent4: She felt a sense of empowerment holding the document granting her seizins.
meanings.sent5: The king's seizins of the crown jewels symbolized his authority over the kingdom.
